title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 304/84 of 6 February 1984 fixing for the 1984 marketing year the reference prices for cucumbers
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 304/84
of 6 February 1984
fixing for the 1984 marketing year the reference prices for cucumbers
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN
COMMUNITIES
main_body:
1. For the 1984 marketing year, the reference prices for cucumbers (subheading 07.01 P I of the Common Customs Tariff), expressed in ECU per 100 kilograms net of packed products of class I, of all sizes, shall be as follows:
- February (from 11 to 20): 131,12
(from 21 to 29): 112,56
- March: 110,46
- April: 90,14
- May: 75,77
- June: 58,78
- July: 43,68
- August: 44,02
- September: 52,05
- October: 79,81
- November (from 1 to 10): 79,81
2. For the purpose of calculating the entry price, the prices for cucumbers, not produced under glass, imported from third countries shall, after deduction of customs duties, be multiplied by the following conversion factors:
- from 11 February to 30 September: 1,30,
- from 1 October to 10 November: 1,00.

This Regulation shall enter into force on 11 February 1984.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 6 February 1984.
For the Commission
Poul DALSAGER
Member of the Commission
